revised_title: The Unique Structure of Ground and Polished Diamonds
tldr: The author examines the structure of a diamond lens and discovers that its flat surface is covered in minute bands, which are the edges of veins or layers with different reflective properties. This unique structure is preserved even after the diamond has been ground and polished, and it is hypothesized that this may be due to the thinness and ease of exposure of these veins during the grinding process.
